div.p: Clustering, medium-diameter rattan. Stem to 20 m long or more, with sheaths to 1.8 cm in diameter, without sheaths to 1.3 cm. Leaves 1 m long or more, ecirrate; sheath green, younger sheaths covered with a white powder; sparingly armed with spines; spines to 0.5 cm long; knee present; ocrea slightly developed; petiole and rachis spiny on the sides; spines straight, 1.25-3.45 cm long, younger sheaths covered with a white powder; leaflets ca. 12.5-23.5 x 1.2-2.2 cm, fasciculate, narrowly lanceolate, midvein prominent. Inflorescence long; drooping; primary sheath tightly sheathing, with spines to 0.8 cm long; partial inflorescence to 30 cm long; secondary sheath tightly sheathing, unarmed; rachilla to 15 cm long, 2 cm apart. Fruit globose, 0.9 cm across, green,turns grey white on maturity, scales in 18 vertical rows, deeply channelled; endosperm not ruminate.
Used in furniture industry; ripened fruits are consumed by man, animals and birds.
